channel.title: Smelting method for delta

item.title: Smelting method for delta
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I think the concept of iron(50% chance) should’ve been applied to everything, but nontheless you still get experience.

I don’t mean that they should have only an ore such as just having one runite ore.

Read full topic

item.title: Smelting method for delta
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

oreSmelt

Would be better naming than:

oreSmelting

and

smeltCall

Would be supreme with Super/Interfacing.

This could also be written originally. I’m confused as to why you just wouldn’t use a Supervising Class. I refuse to pick this apart due to you trying to be original and creative however. Good job.

Read full topic

item.title: Smelting method for delta
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

runescape sucks:

Looks like normal smelting

Kinda, but you’ll only need one coal ore to smith things such as adamant.
and as for iron, you’ll need to ores, instead of it being 50%

Nonetheless, thanks for the reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Smelting method for delta
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Related to my smelting concept in gen. discussion.

public void oreSmelting(int ore1, int ore2, int bar, int xp) { c.closeInterface(); if (c.playerHasItem(ore1, 1) && c.playerHasItem(ore2, 1)) { c.deleteItem(ore1, 1); c.deleteItem(ore2, 1); c.addItem(bar, 1); c.sM("You make a bar."); c.setAnimation(899); c.addSkillXP(xp, 13); } }

Read full topic
